meanings.definition: To write or print (words or letters) above or outside something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys superscribing her name on all her books.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to practice superscribing their signatures neatly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel kept superscribing acorns on the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like superscribing his heart with her name.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush danced gracefully, superscribing intricate patterns on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To mark with a superior or higher rank.
meanings.sent1: The general would often superscribe his signature on important documents.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to superscribe the brave knight for his valor in battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat humorously tried to superscribe itself as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to superscribe her in the eyes of all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The golden crown superscribed his head, marking him as the chosen one.
